text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with pomegranate braised lamb
that's right it's the middle of november
and it doesn't get more seasonal than
this so pull up a hay bale grab a cup of
mulled cider and check this out
alright so we're going to start with
some lamb shoulder chops this is about
three pounds I really like lamb shoulder
for this dish it braises beautifully and
yes there's a few small bones in there
but that's okay they're easy to eat
around in fact you can pull those right
out when it cooks and it does add flavor
as this braises alright we're going to
season that generously with salt and
pepper on both sides of course and then
I'm going to sear it really well on the
stove so I have my skillet on high heat
little bit of vegetable oil I'm going to
place in my lamb and I'm going to do
about four five minutes per side I want
a really nice brown crust and this
searing step really adds a lot of flavor
one of the major differences between
restaurant food and your average home
cook restaurants know to get a really
really deep brown sear on things now by
the way the pan I'm searing here is
actually the pan I'm going to braise in
okay so ideally you're using a big
skillet like this that has a
tight-fitting lid that makes life a lot
easier so while my lamb is finishing to
sear I'm going to slice up an onion just
like that when the lamb is done I'm
going to remove it to a plate I'm going
to reduce the heat down to medium I'm
going to throw in my onions with a pinch
of salt and we're just going to give
these a couple minutes I don't really
need these to break down and caramelize
and get soft I'm just going to give them
a little color so maybe three or four
minutes when they look like that I'm
going to throw in some garlic just give
that about 30 seconds I'm going to
deglaze with pomegranate juice
pomegranate juice is very easy to find
in supermarkets these days you know
you've seen it it comes in that Kim
Kardashian shaped bottle alright it's
not cheap but it's really really nice
I'm talking about the juice I'm also
going to add a splash of aged balsamic
vinegar the good stuff don't buy cheap
balsamic vinegars if you can help it I'm
going to raise the heat up bring it to a
boil
and while it's reducing a little bit I'm
going to add a pinch of dry rosemary and
some fresh mint and I know what you're
thinking aren't you supposed to put
fresh mint on a dish at the end sure you
can do that I'm going to do both mint
tastes different when it's cooked into a
dish then if you just top a dish with it
so why only do one or the other all
right so we're going to put some in now
and as you'll see later we're gonna top
with fresh mint to finish I'm also going
to add a big pinch of red chili flakes
all right and you shouldn't eat any salt
in this because the meat was well
seasoned but I'll let you be the judge
of that okay when this mixture is
basically reduced by half turn off the
heat place your lamb back in any juices
that accumulated on the plate it rested
on pour in here don't waste that it's
good stuff then I'm going to take my
tongs and just kind of smother these
with those onions so I'm going to cover
the lamb with the onion garlic mixture
I'm gonna cover it with a lid a
tight-fitting lid I'm gonna place that
in a low oven 300 degrees for just about
two hours or until pop quiz that's right
fork-tender cook it until it's tender
there's no way to screw it up and I know
some smartass just said oh I could screw
it up no you can don't argue
you can't screw this up cook it until
it's tender if it's not tender
put it back in till it is alright we're
going to remove the meat and we're going
to turn the heat back on to reduce the
sauce maybe a little more it depends you
could use it like this you could reduce
it all the way down to a thick glaze if
you wanted you know you've paid the cost
to be the sauce boss so you have to make
these decisions i boiled mine for
another five minutes or so if you want
to skim some of the fat off the top go
for it you don't have to get it all
that's flavor but if you see big pools
of lamb fat go ahead and skim it off and
right there mine was perfect so it's not
really thick it's just concentrated now
final flavor adjustments I tasted the
sauce and I decided it needed a little
bit of sweetness so I stirred in a nice
big spoon of honey and it was absolutely
unbelievable all right you're going to
want to taste for salt and pepper of
course and then we're ready to serve
this up and by the way do not adjust
your
computer monitors the lamb is darker I
refrigerated mine overnight before I
shot this final scene so we'll get
darker if you do it the next day the
good news is I think it's even better
anyway I served it with roast pumpkin
some pumpkin seeds some fresh mint and
of course some gloriously beautiful
pomegranate jewels also known as seeds
all right if you haven't seen our video
how to get those well making a big mess
make sure you check it out and that was
just a magnificent fall entree that soft
succulent lamb the tang is from the
pomegranate juice and the balsamic
vinegar that little touch of sweetness
from the honey the fresh herb just
unbelievable like I said you can make it
the day before it reheats perfectly so
anyway head over to food wishes comm for
all the ingredient amounts and more
information as usual and as always enjoy
